trans-unit.source: Represents image data returned by a decoder and accepted by encoders.

BitmapFrame provides additional functionality not defined by <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by providing access to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.Thumbnail%2A> associated with a particular frame of an image.

BitmapFrame also supports the writing of metadata information by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Metadata%2A> property or the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter%2A> method.
Any BitmapFrame returned from a decoder is always frozen.
If you require a modifiable copy, you must first create a copy of the BitmapFrame by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Clone%2A> method.
Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] format images support multiple frames.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets a value that represents the base <xref:System.Uri> of the current context.
The <xref:System.Uri> of the current context.

When overridden in a derived class, gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref> objects that are associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
A read-only collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref> objects that are associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
The `bitmapStream` can be closed after the frame is created only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option is used.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option retains the stream until the frame is needed.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.Create%28System.IO.Stream%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption%29> method to specify create and cache options.
The <xref:System.IO.Stream> that is used to construct the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.IO.Stream>.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri>.
The <xref:System.Uri> that identifies the source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri>.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that is used to construct this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri> with the specified <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref>.
Create is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The location of the bitmap from which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> is created.
The caching requirements for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri> with the specified <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref>.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> with the specified thumbnail.
The source from which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> is constructed.
A thumbnail image of the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> with the specified thumbnail.

Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.IO.Stream> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option if you wish to close the `bitmapStream` after the bitmap is created.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option retains access to the stream until the bitmap is needed and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.
The stream from which this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> is constructed.
The options that are used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The cache option that is used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.IO.Stream> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.

Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.
The location of the bitmap from which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> is created.
The options that are used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The cache option that is used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.

Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref>.
Create is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The location of the bitmap from which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> is created.
The options that are used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The cache option that is used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The caching requirements for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref:System.Uri> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref>.

Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> with the specified thumbnail, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that is used to construct this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
A thumbnail image of the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The metadata to associate with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref> objects that are associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref> from a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> with the specified thumbnail, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref>.

When overridden in a derived class, creates an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter"></xref>, which can be used to associate metadata with a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.

Metadata can only be added or edited using the CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter if the image file contains enough room for the new metadata; otherwise, metadata can be added using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Metadata%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the decoder associated with this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the thumbnail image associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents a thumbnail of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
